name: Darul Huda Corporation
mission: Darul Huda Islamic Center is not just a mosque for prayers rather it is a center for preserving an Islamic identity. Helping to build and support a diverse and friendly Muslim community represented by dozens of different ethnicities based on the Holy Quran and the Sunnah of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).
programs: Quran Recitation and Islamic Studies Classes

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization serves a specific religious and cultural niche, which may offer lower alignment for general donors compared to high-urgency humanitarian causes [1]. As a Sadaqah-eligible entity, it provides a pathway for general voluntary giving rather than mandatory zakat [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity focuses on capacity building through educational programs and community meals, reporting a total revenue of $975,808 [3]. While it maintains a high program expense ratio of 97.5%, the lack of third-party verification and cost-per-beneficiary data results in a medium impact score [1].

strengths.detail: The organization directs a <cite id="8">97.5% program expense ratio</cite> toward its core mission, significantly exceeding the <cite id="11">peer program ratio median of 80.0%</cite>.
Darul Huda Corp maintains a <cite id="9">fundraising efficiency of $0.00</cite> per dollar raised, ensuring maximum resource allocation to community services.
The charity maintains <cite id="12">14.7 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing a strong financial safety net.

strengths_deep_dive: Darul Huda Corp's financial model is characterized by extreme leaness, as evidenced by its <cite id="8">97.5% program expense ratio</cite> in 2023. This level of efficiency is rare even within the religious sector, where the <cite id="11">industry standard is typically 75%</cite>. The organization's ability to scale is reflected in its <cite id="7">33.0% revenue growth</cite> over three years, moving from <cite id="13">$551,326 in 2021</cite> to nearly $1 million in 2023. This growth has been achieved while maintaining <cite id="14">97.5% independent board members</cite>, suggesting a commitment to objective oversight despite the small size of the governing body.
rich_narrative.summary: Darul Huda Corp is a community-focused non-profit based in Springfield, Virginia, dedicated to providing <cite id="1">religious, cultural, and educational opportunities</cite> to the local Muslim population. The organization serves as a spiritual hub, offering essential services such as <cite id="2">daily and Jummah prayers</cite>, alongside structured <cite id="3">Quran recitation and Islamic studies classes</cite>. Beyond ritual worship, the charity fosters community cohesion through its <cite id="4">Iftar and dinner programs</cite> and organized <cite id="5">Eid festivals and prayers</cite>. Financially, the organization has demonstrated significant growth, reporting <cite id="6">$975,808 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="7">33.0% three-year revenue CAGR</cite>. A defining characteristic of its operations is a lean financial model where the organization reported a <cite id="8">97.5% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that nearly all contributions are directed toward its religious and educational programming. This efficiency is further highlighted by its <cite id="9">$0.00 fundraising efficiency</cite>, meaning no donor funds were spent on professional fundraising efforts during the reporting period. While the organization maintains <cite id="10">$983,738 in total assets</cite>, it operates with a small governance structure that presents opportunities for future institutional strengthening.
